page.title: 03CORNBURY/WYCHWOOD FORESTRY
page.content: {728ha of Cornbury is forested with l03 {ha conifers and 625ha deciduous in the {ancient woodland of Wychwood.}Conifers are mainly {Douglas Fir and Scots Pine planted post 1945 on forest edge and {Norway and Sitka Spruce}mixed with { {oak}in {Cockshoothill Copse}. Hard- woods are {ash, beech, thorn, sycamore {and sessile, turkey and pedunculate {oaks}. Under a 5-year {Forestry Grant} scheme contractors are removing mature hardwoods in areas of 1ha and below, thinning out young natural growth to encourage ash-pole regrowth and plant- ing the gaps with bought-in {sessile {oak, beech, cherry and some alder}. These are protected by biodegradable polypropylene tree-guards l.2m high from {rabbits and hares.}Above this {fallow deer and grey squirrels may {strip the bark. Softwoods thinned 2ce {in 1st 30yrs, final crop 30yrs later.}
